newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - April 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - April 10.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on the front page of its business section on April 10:
WASHINGTON - The Federal Trade Commission said nearly half of all police and fire department fundraisers are actually for-profit groups that pocket the money they collect.
NEW YORK - Procter & Gamble Co said it will acquire the world's largest maker of tampons -- Tambrands Inc -- for $1.85 billion.
WASHINGTON - Former Sen. Bob Dole, the Republican presidential candidate in 1996, has agreed to join a prestigious Washington law firm.
HO CHI MINH CITY - U.S. Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin finds cordiality on his trade trip but the legacy of the Vietnam War keeps popping up.
